result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquas Isaac Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent to Deliver THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 3 years of Initial Confinement.
Concurrent with: Credit of one day. 
*4/24/2018  Concurrent with count two and concurrent with case 13CF003199.

superMiscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.
- Employment or school.
- No contact with illegal drugs users or drug dealers.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 7/1/2024.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court costs and victim witness surcharges  are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 7/1/2024.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at zero.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

*4/24/2018  Concurrent with count one and concurrent with case 13CF003199.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (49 pages) commencing on 07-01-2014 SENTENCINGreceived and filed.

Defendant Marquas Isaac Davis in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Correction made to the PSI on the record.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by : Willie D.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 1 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 3 years of initial confinement.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS .  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 1 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 3 years of initial confinement.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/1/2024; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/1/2024; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-No contact with illegal drugs users or drug dealers
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Presentence Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Marquas Isaac Davis in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Bail remains the same.  Court grants defense motion for PSI.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquas Isaac Davis in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense attorney has a scheduling conflict in another county and requests adjournment.  Court grants.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/13/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Marquas Isaac Davis in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
